item.title: Chronic Limb Ischaemia
item.description: A 72 year old man is referred to the vascular outpatient department. He has a background of hypertension, hyperlipidaemia, and type 2 diabetes mellitus. He reports pain in his right calf when mobilising over 200m over the last 6 months. This pain is relieved by rest. He reports no rest pain and no ulcers.
